profile.profileName: [National Folklore Archives Initiative] Union catalog for multi-repository initiative.
profile.profileDescription: This custom profile configures CA to act as a union catalog for multiple repositories with varying degrees of cataloging depth.

label.name_singular: Translated (title variant supplied in other than original language)
label.name_plural: Translated (title variant supplied in other than original language)

label.name: Accruals
label.description: This element informs the user of anticipated additions to the unit being described. An accrual is an acquisition of archival materials additional to that already in the custody of the repository.

label.name: Immediate Source of Acquisition
label.description: Record information about changes of ownership or custody of the materials being described that do not involve direct acquisition by the repository and that are significant for its authenticity, integrity, and interpretation in the Custodial History Element.

label.name: Appraisal
label.description: This element provides information about the rationale for appraisal decisions, destruction actions, and disposition schedules that are relevant to the understanding and use of the materials being described.

label.name: System of Arrangement
label.description: This element identifies the various aggregations of archival materials, their relationships, or the sequence of documents within them.

label.name: Existence and Location of Copies
label.description: This element indicates the existence, location, and availability of copies or other reproductions of the materials being described when they are available for use in an institution, or for loan or purchase, or available electronically. Do not mention copies in private hands or copies made for personal use.

label.name: Description
label.description: An account of the resource.

label.name: Source of description
label.description: Source of item description. This should be a formal citation if possible. For informal sources a narrative description is acceptable.

label.name: Georeference
label.description: CGeoreferences define the existence of something in physical space by establishing a location in terms of map projections or coordinate systems. Use this field to select coordinates that define the location of the geographic subject of the resource. You may create multiple entries if necessary.

label.name: General Notes
label.description: This element provides information that cannot be accommodated in any of the defined elements of description.

label.name: GeoNames
label.description: A Geographic lookup that takes search text, passes it to the GeoNames search service and provides a dropdown with search results (ordered by score). Selected geoname is stored as both text (name, country, continent and ID) and the service URL identifier.

label.name: Administrative Note
label.description: This field is included as a place to hold information about the entity that is useful for managing the record, but will not be shown to the public.

label.name: Language
label.description: Select a language associated with the resource being described. You may create multiple entries if necessary.

label.name: Library of Congress Subject Headings
label.description: Begin typing a subject term to search the Library of Congress Subject Headings database. Please make certain you have selected a subject heading that relates to the content of the resource being described. Ask yourself, what is this resource about? You can create multiple entries if necessary.

label.name: Library of Congress Naming Authority
label.description: Begin typing the first few letters of a name in this box to search the Library of Congress Name Authority Headings to search for an existing record in the LC database. If you find an exact match, please select the name. If you are having difficulty, you can visit this site for better searching features: http://authorities.loc.gov/

label.name: Geographic Area
label.description: Enter terms to search the Library of Congress MARC Geographic Area controlled vocabulary, which documents separate countries, first order political divisions of some countries, regions, geographic features, areas in outer space, and celestial bodies. This documents the geographic subject of the resource. You can enter more than one.

label.name: Alternate identifiers
label.description: List alternate identifiers here. These are alphanumeric codes used at some point to identify the object which are employed outside the NFAI database.

label.name: Entity Date
label.description: Enter birth and death years for the individual (or start and end dates for an organization or meeting), e.g. 1901-1987.

label.name: Date
label.description: A point or period of time associated with an event in the lifecycle of the resource. Select the type of date from the list. You can create multiple entries.

label.name: Format
label.description: audio tape format

label.name: Condition Notes
label.description: physical condition notes

label.name: Copyright Information
label.description: copyright holder

label.name: Credits
label.description: credits of the work

label.name: Custodial History
label.description: This element provides information on changes of ownership or custody of the material being described, from the time it left the possession of the creator until it was acquired by the repository that is significant for its authenticity, integrity, and interpretation.

label.name: Extent
label.description: If necessary, provide information about the physical dimensions of the resource being described. Select the type of measurement from the dropdown box. You can create multiple entries if necessary.

label.name: Unit of Measurement
label.description: Units used to measure width and height of the material.

label.name: Genre Form
label.description: A term indicating the form, genre and/or physical characteristics of the materials being described. Genre terms designate specific kinds of materials distinguished by the style or technique of their intellectual content (e.g., biographies, catechisms, essays, hymns or reviews). Form and physical characteristic terms designate functionally and historically specific kinds of materials.

label.name: Administrative/Biographical History Element
label.description: A description of the context in which the materials being described were created, assembled, and/or maintained is as important as the description of the materials themselves

label.name: Scope and Content Note
label.description: This element provides information about the nature of the materials and activities reflected in the unit being described to enable users to judge its potential relevance.

label.name: Conditions Governing Access
label.description: This element provides information about access restrictions due to the nature of the information in the materials being described, such as those imposed by the donor, by the repository, or by statutory/regulatory requirements.

label.name: Existence and Location of Originals
label.description: This element indicates the existence, location, and availability of originals when the materials being described consist of copies, and the originals are not held by the repository

label.name: Conditions Governing Reproduction
label.description: This element identifies any restrictions on reproduction due to copyright or other reasons, as well as restrictions on further use of the materials being described, such as publication after access has been provided.

label.name: Copyright Notice
label.description: General statement of copyright status governing materials being described.

label.name: Preferred Citation
label.description: This element expresses the preferred citation to use when referencing the materials being described.

label.name: Publication Notes
label.description: This element identifies any publications that are about or are based on the use, study, or analysis of the materials being described.

label.name: Related Archival Materials
label.description: This element indicates the existence and location of archival materials that are closely related to the materials being described by provenance, sphere of activity, or subject matter, either in the same repository, in other repositories, or elseware.

label.name: Summary
label.description: Enter a brief description of the WHO, WHAT, WHEN, WHERE, and WHY of the resource being described.

label.name: Coverage
label.description: The spatial or temporal topic of the resource

label.name: Temporal Coverage
label.description: Enter the temporal topic of the resource. Temporal coverage may be a named period, date, or date range. Temporal information may be given by numbers or by text.

label.name: Subject
label.description: The topic of the resource.

label.name: Type
label.description: The nature or genre of the resource.

label.name: Format
label.description: The file format or physical medium or dimensions of the resource.

label.name: Rights
label.description: Information about rights held in and over the resource.

label.name: Source
label.description: A related resource from which the described resource is derived.

label.name: Loan document
label.description: Any documentation related to the loan such as a Loan Agreement.

label.name: Shelf
label.description: The shelf location of an object.

label.name: Type of Repository
label.description: Select from the provided list. You may choose as many types as describe the repository.

label.name: Biography
label.description: Narrative biography for entity. This is the primary text used to document the entity. The source should be a formal citation if possible. For informal sources a narrative description is acceptable.

label.name: Repository Description
label.description: Provide a brief summary or description of the repository.

label.name: Description Source
label.description: Source of a description. This should be a formal citation if possible. For informal sources a narrative description is acceptable.

label.name: Repository Contact
label.description: Name and role of person(s) responsible for managing and/or providing access to collections at this repository.

label.name: Repository Code
label.description: The MARC Code List for Organizations contains short alphabetic codes used to represent names of libraries and other kinds of organizations that need to be identified in the bibliographic environment.

label.name: Repository Parent
label.description: Name of any parent institution(s) with which the repository is associated.

label.name: Materials Designation
label.description: Select from this controlled-vocabulary browser to document the type of material represented by the resource being described. You may create multiple entries if necessary.

label.name: Repository State
label.description: Please enter the US state or territory where the repository is located

settings.setting: This simple guide helps you visualize where this record exists within a hierarchical structure of relationships among it and other objects.
This unique alphanumeric identifier is generated by the system.

Enter a unique identifier for the resource being described in this record. If it is a collection, then enter the collection ID from the home repository, e.g. AFC 2004/004. If it is an individual item, enter the unique ID that separates it from other items, e.g. afc2004004_sr001. You may enter more than one.

Enter the name of the repository that is the home of this resource. You must create a repository record in this database for the home repository before it will be available to you in this list. You can create multiple entries here if necessary.
Enter the title of the resource being described in this record.
Enter any alternate titles for the resource. Select the type of alternate title. You can create multiple entries.

Enter names of individuals or organizations responsible for the creation of this resource. You must create an Entity record for an individual or organization before it will become available to you in this list. You can create multiple entries if necessary.
Indicates if this record will be accessible to the public or not.

If you have additional subject headings that you would like to use, and that are not included in the Library of Congress Subject Headings, please enter them here. You can create multiple entries if necessary.

Use this field to select entities from the NFAI database who are subjects (topics) of this resource (as opposed to Creators or Contributors). An entity record must be created for an individual or organization before it will be available to you in this list. You may create multiple entries if necessary.

Use this field to include external sources that include bibliographic or descriptive information about this resource. Entries must be in full URL form, e.g. http://http://research.culturalequity.org/home-audio.jsp

This field documents relationships between Objects and other Objects. It is meant to show non-hierarchical relationships, such as topical or temporal relationships. Use the hierarchical browser to create hierarchical relationships among objects. You can create multiple entries if necessary.

This field documents relationships between Entities and Objects (collections, items, etc.). It should reflect a relationship between the Entity and each Object that references it. You can create multiple entries.

This field documents relationships between Repositories and Objects (collections, items, etc.). It should reflect a relationship between the Repository and each Object that belongs to the repository. You can create multiple entries.
This unique alphanumeric identifier is generated by the system.

Enter information about existing authority database records that document this entity (individual, meeting, or organization), especially that of the Library of Congress Name Authorities (please include the LCCN here). If from another controlled list, include the ID here and choose "other" as ID Source. You can enter more than one.
Enter the preferred version of each name-part here. You will be able to enter alternate versions on the Alternate Names tab.
Enter any alternate names for the entity. You can create multiple entries.

This field documents relationships between Entities and Objects (collections, items, etc.). It should reflect a relationship between the Entity and each Object that references it. You can create multiple entries.
This field documents relationships between Entities and other Entities. This can be used to show parent-child relationships, or sibling or cousin-type relationships. You can create multiple entries.

Use this field to include external sources that document biographical or historical information about this entity. Entries must be in full URL form, e.g. http://www.culturalequity.org/alanlomax/ce_alanlomax_index.php
This unique alphanumeric identifier is generated by the system.

Enter the official name of the repository, e.g. Vermont Folklife Center. Please use correct capitalization and punctuation. This is the name that will be displayed by the system wherever this repository is mentioned.
If there are other names by which the repository is known, please enter them here. You may include as many as exist.
Enter the main (and any related) URL for the repository. You MUST use the full URL format, e.g. http://www.loc.gov/folklife. You may enter more than one URL is necessary.
Enter the current and official address for the repository
Enter the current and official telephone number for the repository. Use the following standard format: (XXX) XXX-XXXX.
Enter the general email address for making contact with the repository.

This field documents relationships between Repositories and Objects (collections, items, etc.). It should reflect a relationship between the Repository and each Object that belongs to the repository. You can create multiple entries.

This field documents relationships between Repositories and other Repositories. This can be used to show parent-child relationships, or sibling or cousin-type relationships. You can create multiple entries.
